intro: Swertia parnassiifolia, commonly known as the Parnassius leaf swertia, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. It has a slender stem that supports its clusters of tubular flowers, which bloom in late summer. Swertia parnassiifolia is valued for its ornamental beauty and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
